description.p: This command shows the AS-level topology previously loaded with the command bgp topology loadbgp_topology_load. The default output format (obtained without using the --format option) shows a single AS relationship per line. For each AS relationship, a code identifies the relationship type. A textual description of the AS relationship type can be obtained by mentioning the --verbose option.

An alternate output format can be obtained by using the --format= option. A single alternate format is supported : "graphviz". This allows to obtain an output file suitable for use with AT&T's graphviz tools, in particulat dot and neato.
The --output= option allows to redirect the command's output to a file. The file name is provided as the value of the --output= option.
